lazymoney.settings.enable.title: Enable Lazy Money feature
lazymoney.settings.enable.hint: Automatically convert currency based on the system rule
lazymoney.settings.addConvert.title: Convert when adding money
lazymoney.settings.addConvert.hint: Automatically convert currency to higher denominations when adding money instead of the default behaviour of preserving the denominations you receive.
lazymoney.settings.ignoreElectrum.title: Ignore electrum (Only for Dnd5e)
lazymoney.settings.ignoreElectrum.hint: When converting, ignore electrum. This won't affect directly adding or removing it, except in the case when "Convert when adding money" is also enabled.
lazymoney.settings.chatLog.title: Chat log
lazymoney.settings.chatLog.hint: Whisper any currency changes to the GM.
lazymoney.settings.price.title: Item price attribute
lazymoney.settings.price.hint: Here you can configure what the attribute path is for each item's price. For example, in D&D5e system, each item's quantity is stored in the item's "item.system.price" attribute, so you'd put "system.price" in this setting.
lazymoney.settings.quantity.title: Item quantity attribute
lazymoney.settings.quantity.hint: Here you can configure what the attribute path is for each item's quantity. For example, in D&D5e system, each item's quantity is stored in the item's "item.system.quantity" attribute, so you'd put "system.quantity" in this setting.
lazymoney.settings.currencies.title: Currencies
lazymoney.settings.currencies.label: Configure Currencies
lazymoney.settings.currencies.hint: This setting define the currencies that are eligible for pickup, which may not be actual items but numerical inputs on the character sheet.
lazymoney.settings.secondaryCurrencies.h: This setting define secondary currencies, similar to but separate from regular currencies. These cannot have exchange rates or be split into other custom currencies.
lazymoney.settings.currencyDecimalDigits: This setting defines the lowest decimal digit your currencies round to. For example in a modern setting with modern currencies, '0.01' allows for two decimal digits. This is not used if you have more than one currency.
lazymoney.settings.cssVariables.title: CSS Variables Styles
lazymoney.settings.cssVariables.label: Configure CSS Variables
lazymoney.settings.cssVariables.hint: This allows you to configure the various CSS variables that drive the colors and other styles within item piles' interfaces.
lazymoney.settings.pricePresets.title: Price Presets
lazymoney.settings.pricePresets.label: Configure Price Presets
lazymoney.settings.pricePresets.hint: Here you can configure custom preset prices that you can then easily import onto items.
lazymoney.settings.reset.title: Reset settings to default
lazymoney.settings.reset.label: Reset Settings To Default
lazymoney.settings.reset.hint: This will reset all of the settings of back to the active game system's default.
lazymoney.settings.debug.title: Enable debugging
lazymoney.settings.debug.label: Prints debug messages to the console
lazymoney.dialogs.resetsettings.title: Reset Module Settings
lazymoney.dialogs.resetsettings.content: Are you sure you want to reset all of the module settings to the current system's defaults? THIS CANNOT BE UNDONE!
lazymoney.dialogs.nosystemfound.title: System Not Recognized
lazymoney.dialogs.nosystemfound.content:
This system is not currently fully supported. This means that the module does not know how to best handle this system's items, but can still operate in a limited fashion.

You can configure the module's settings yourself, but it requires a bit of technical know-how.

If you have any questions, ping Wasp#2005 on the Foundry discord.
lazymoney.dialogs.systemfound.title: System Recognized
lazymoney.dialogs.systemfound.content:
This system was previously not supported, but in an recent update it was added as a supported system!

Do you want to load this system's default Item Pile settings?
